intro: Coelocarpum humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's coelocarpum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on rocky substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
